Also the Sunomono(cucumber salad) is good for appetizer too(I uploading lots of pic of them lol). For the handroll, Yunomi special, Unagi, Scallop, Tuna are fire! Don't forget join waitlist through yelp before you arrive. It is usually crowded during lunch or dinner time.

First time at Yunomi and it definitely wonâ€™t be the last!

The atmosphere is modern with a great sense of style â€” clean, welcoming! I tried a few hand rolls, and every single one was incredibly fresh and flavorful. The Negi Toro and Yunomi Special were absolute standouts â€” seriously, next-level good.

The staff were super friendly and made the experience even better with some pleasant, casual conversation. Itâ€™s the kind of place where you instantly feel comfortable.

Highly recommend if you're into quality food and a chill vibe. Will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.raw_text:
Stopped in here for just a beer and the kitchen accidentally made me a spicy salmon hand roll even though I had closed my tab. They let me have it for free and oh my God it was the best sushi roll I have ever had in my life. Perfectly cooked rice, well marinated salmon that wasn't too spicy and the seaweed wrap wasn't crunchy, which I prefer. This place is truly a hidden gem you need to go to! I would have reopened my tab if my group wasn't waiting for me.

reviews.raw_text:
popular handroll spot.

The atmosphere was welcoming and the service attentive, and overall, it delivered a solid dining experience.

That said, speaking from the perspective of someone familiar with traditional Asian flavors and techniques, the food leaned more toward a modern, Western-friendly interpretation of handrolls. The ingredients were fresh and presentation clean, but the depth and authenticity that youâ€™d typically find in more traditional or regionally rooted establishments felt somewhat muted.

Itâ€™s clear the place is doing well and resonates with a broad audience, especially those newer to Japanese cuisine â€” which is great to see in terms of expanding appreciation for the food. Still, for those seeking a more nuanced or heritage-inspired experience, this might not fully hit the mark.

Atmosphere: 5
Group size: 1 person, 2 people

reviews.raw_text:
I visited Yunomi Handroll on a Sunday around lunchtime, and while some elements of the meal were enjoyable, the overall experience left a lot to be desired.

To start with the positives: the Unagi was flavorful and well-preparedâ€”tender, with just the right amount of sweetness and char. The fried shrimp appetizer was another highlight: crispy, hot, and perfectly seasoned. Service at the counter was fast and efficient once we were seated, and the food came out quickly.

Unfortunately, getting to that point was a whole ordeal. Parking was a nightmare, and once we arrived, there was a wait to be seated despite I got waitlisted 45 minutes ago. Once seated, we found the seating to be very uncomfortableâ€”tight spacing, stiff stools, and a general lack of comfort that made it hard to settle in and enjoy the meal. For a place where youâ€™re meant to sit and eat rolls fresh as they come out, the setup felt rushed and cramped.

Bottom line: Yunomi has some tasty menu items, particularly the Unagi and fried shrimp, and the kitchen moves fastâ€”but the logistics and environment make it hard to recommend, especially on a busy weekend. If you go, consider visiting at an off-hour and prepare to eat quickly.

reviews.raw_text:
Really love this place. Waited 30 minutes for a table on a Friday night. The seating is around the kitchen/ bar top area and itâ€™s nice and quiet. Perfect date night spot. They season the seaweed perfectly thatâ€™s why the hand rolls are out of this world. We each got the 6 hand roll combo and couldnâ€™t even finish the 6th it was so filling. Our favorites were the spicy tuna, salmon and the scallop. Our bill came out at to around $70 for two, not bad at all. Highly recommend this place!

reviews.raw_text:
Iâ€™ve been a loyal customer at this sushi restaurant for a long time, dining here multiple times and spending a lot of money. Unfortunately, my most recent visit was completely ruined by the poor customer service.

We waited over an hour to be seated, only to be rushed out just 10 minutes past their 45-minute dining limit. While I understand restaurant policies, the way the manager handled it was unacceptable. Instead of politely reminding us of the rule, she rudely told us we had to leave because "there are other people waiting." There was no courtesy, no professionalismâ€”just an attitude that made us feel unwelcome.

After all the times Iâ€™ve supported this restaurant, being treated like this was extremely disappointing. Good food means nothing when the service makes you feel disrespected. Sadly, I wonâ€™t be returning, and I wouldnâ€™t recommend this place to anyone who values good customer service.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $100+
Food: 3
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 3

reviews.raw_text:
I have had both kazunori and Sugar Fish. Their rolls were filling enough to get me through the night, but in terms of taste and variety, it is still not at the same level as kazunori.

Their yunomi special is a good opener and the baked crab a good closer. I wasn't impressed by the softshell crab nor their unagi + shrimp tempura. Overall however it is worth the try.

The atmosphere of the place is pretty chill and cozy, great to go out with a small group/date. Service was excellent, the staff was supper attentive and candid which helps the whole atmosphere.

Recommended dishes: Yellowtail Serrano Sashimi
reviews.plain_text:
I have had both kazunori and Sugar Fish. Their rolls were filling enough to get me through the night, but in terms of taste and variety, it is still not at the same level as kazunori.

Their yunomi special is a good opener and the baked crab a good closer. I wasn't impressed by the softshell crab nor their unagi + shrimp tempura. Overall however it is worth the try.

The atmosphere of the place is pretty chill and cozy, great to go out with a small group/date. Service was excellent, the staff was supper attentive and candid which helps the whole atmosphere.

reviews.raw_text:
No-frills handroll experience that focuses on the essentials. The handrolls are solid across the board, but the standout here is actually the spicy albacore crispy rice. The albacore is soft, enhanced by the truffle soy sauce. But itâ€™s the crunchy onions, generously piled on top, that enhance it further. I was even using them to garnish my handrolls. The wasabi peas were the right temperature of warm, an addictive snack to munch on before the handrolls.

The tuna, albacore, salmon, shrimp tempura, and yellowtail handrolls all consist of fresh fish and fairly crisp seaweed. However, the rice-to-fish ratio felt a little off for me. The rolls were substantial, but I did feel the rice could be toned down a bit. Still, the quality of the ingredients, paired with the efficient sushi bar service, made for a satisfying meal. Good value for the price. The space is light and airy, the right mix of casual and contemporary for a quick handroll fix.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Lunch

reviews.raw_text:
We visited Yunomi last weekend with a few friends for a casual dinner, and I was excited to check it out after hearing so many great things.
The ambiance at Yunomi is cozy and sleek, with warm lighting and minimalist decor. The space feels inviting, with a relaxed vibe. The seating was comfortable, but I could see how it might get a little tight during busy hours.

Our server was friendly and knowledgeable, offering helpful suggestions from the menu. The food came out at a great pace and didnâ€™t feel rushed at all. The staff checked in with us just the right amount of times without being intrusive and happily explained whenever we had questions.

Now, the hand rolls. The food exceeded my expectations. We each ordered the hand rolls sets, and it was perfectly done with a rich blend of flavors. The apps were also great. Yunomi has single handedly ruined all other hand roll places for me as nothing compares to it now. Looking forward to visiting again.

Parking is a bit hard as the restaurant is located in a busy area with a lot of nearby shops.

Definitely recommend Yunomi. Will be back again.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5

We visited Yunomi last weekend with a few friends for a casual dinner, and I was excited to check it out after hearing so many great things.
The ambiance at Yunomi is cozy and sleek, with warm lighting and minimalist decor. The space feels inviting, with a relaxed vibe. The seating was comfortable, but I could see how it might get a little tight during busy hours.

Our server was friendly and knowledgeable, offering helpful suggestions from the menu. The food came out at a great pace and didnâ€™t feel rushed at all. The staff checked in with us just the right amount of times without being intrusive and happily explained whenever we had questions.

Now, the hand rolls. The food exceeded my expectations. We each ordered the hand rolls sets, and it was perfectly done with a rich blend of flavors. The apps were also great. Yunomi has single handedly ruined all other hand roll places for me as nothing compares to it now. Looking forward to visiting again.

Parking is a bit hard as the restaurant is located in a busy area with a lot of nearby shops.

Definitely recommend Yunomi. Will be back again.

reviews.raw_text:
Canâ€™t say enough. Friendly and efficient staff. Amazing appetizers (get the Rock Shrimp Crispy Rice sushi) coupled with tasty hand rolls made in front of you. Generous size and filling (3 hand rolls plus appetizers filled me up while I usually leave less than full after 6 hand rolls from Kazu Nori). Seating is around the Sushi Bar. Street parking is limited but plenty of options within short walking distance (Little Tokyo).

My experience at the restaurant was quite disappointing. The chairs were extremely uncomfortable, reminiscent of county jail, and posed a risk of causing permanent back damage or a serious fall. The atmosphere was unsettling, with a strong smell of marijuana, and many staff members struggled with English and food handling. While the fish was decent, both versions of the seaweed were terribleâ€”they had a strong, unpleasant odor, almost like roadkill. Until they improve the seating and switch to better seaweed, we wonâ€™t be returning.

reviews.raw_text:
I recently dined at Yunomi with my partner and a group of friends, but unfortunately, our experience left much to be desired. While the food initially tasted fine, we noticed an alarming issue with food handling that we believe led to several of us becoming very ill afterward.

Towards the end of our meal, we observed the staff member preparing our food, wearing the same gloves to handle food and clean the preparation area. Despite seeing us watch, they continued this practice without changing gloves, raising serious concerns about cross-contamination. This is unacceptable for any restaurant, as food safety and cleanliness should be prioritized.

Unfortunately, several of us have been sick with symptoms resembling food poisoning since our visit.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Lunch
Price per person: $50â€“100

reviews.raw_text:
Great hand rolls. Fish was very fresh. The star of the show was the spicy salmon hand roll. The seaweed they use is very interesting. It's slightly crunchy and textured and just creates a very unique, flavorful bite with the smooth spicy salmon. It was a hit, even for my partner who does not typically enjoy hand rolls (crazy, I know!!)

The other rolls were good too but not very memorable - but if I don't remember them as bad, that's good in my books.

reviews.raw_text:
I was excited to try Yunomi after hearing about the quality of the hand rolls from friends. The food was delicious, but I was very disappointed to see (after finishing my meal) that the counter chef put her gloved hand into the rice pot directly after slicing some avocado. Prior to ordering some rolls, I had conveyed to the server that I have a severe allergy to avocado and she assured me that they donâ€™t add avocado to any menu item except the avocado roll. After I mentioned the mishap, the server told me that she had told the chef but offered little apology. The chef was standing right there as we spoke and she said nothing to me also. Given the importance of my request and the caliber of the restaurant, one would assume that more care would be taken and I left feeling ignored. I donâ€™t feel confident in going back and Yunomi should definitely take steps to ensure that gloves are changed and no cross contamination happens when a customer conveys an allergy in advance.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $30â€“50

Atmosphere: 5

reviews.raw_text:
(also posted on their Yelp page)
Yunomi can be compared to Kazu Nori because they make hand rolls.

Food is good. Service is ok. Parking sucks. Ambiance is great.

Yunomi has a small-ish space in side because the seats are along the bar around the kitchen where they make drinks and hand rolls. They have two bathrooms in the back, but the hand washing station is outside the bathrooms. My party of three had to wait about 10-15 minutes even on a week day night.

I personally had five hand rolls and still wasn't completely full. The guy who greeted us when we got seated knew it was our first time there, but he said nothing except the menu is obtained by scanning the QR code on the table. It was good thing I checked out the menu from photos posted online because he came back really quickly to take our orders.

I think the hand roll sets are a cool way to try different fish, but the blue crab and negi toro and unagi are probably the better ones to try. They're more expensive - the negi toro is $11 lol.

There's free parking in the streets, but it took me 30 minutes to finally find a spot and I still had to walk 7 minutes to the restaurant. At least you can get Salt & Straw for dessert across the street.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $30â€“50
Food: 4
Service: 4
Atmosphere: 4

reviews.raw_text:
I love Yunomi! The service is very authentic to a more traditional Japanese service. It's all counter/bar seating, so be prepared for a stool. The menu is deceptive with how simple and clean it is, but the ingredients are all top tier and everything they do, they do well. There is also a wonderful selection of Japanese beverages (beer, sake, etc)

Don't leave without trying one of their house specials (either the yunomi handroll, or the albacore truffle crispy rice).

A note for the managers, purse hooks installed under the bar would have made my experience much better, worrying about my purse falling off the foot rail did take away from my experience a bit.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Lunch
Price per person: $20â€“30
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 4
Recommended dishes: Yellowtail Serrano Sashimi, 5 Hand Rolls
Parking space: Somewhat difficult to find parking
Parking options: Paid parking lot
Parking: You'll need to use a paid lot, but there are multiple lot options within 2 blocks. I recommend the lot near the Alisio apartments.
Kid-friendliness: This isn't a kid-friendly location.
Wheelchair accessibility: While it's all bar seating they do have a wheelchair accessible bar level.

reviews.raw_text:
Food was amazing, service was even better. If you like Kazu Nori, this place is just for you.

We had Allen and Kayla as our servers, they had great recommendations. Could not recommend it more.

reviews.raw_text:
A Michelin-starred hand roll restaurant in Little Tokyo

What I ordered:
Rock Shrimp Tempura 14
Nego Toro 11
Salmon 6.5

Hand rolls are usually ordered in sets of 5-6, but I also wanted to try the creamy shrimp tempura, so I ordered two a la carte (spicy).
Look at the visuals of the shrimp tempuraðŸ’•
The hand rolls were as delicious as you'd expect from a good restaurant, with both the salmon and toro fillings being fresh and delicious. The seaweed was especially crispy, making them incredibly delicious ðŸ˜‹
Recommended!!

reviews.raw_text:
I love coming back to this spot. The staff is always friendly, and their chefs make it an inviting atmosphere. Their hand rolls are all good. The yunomi special is the highlight of the hand rolls, and their ceviche is so good.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $30â€“50
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5
Recommended dishes: Rock Shrimp Tempura
Parking space: Difficult to find parking
Parking options: Paid parking lot, Paid street parking
Parking: It's very hard to find parking in the arts district. There are a few paid parking lots in the vicinity, but it can be packed. Especially on the weekends.

The 6 hand roll set (spicy; with Korean seaweed and spicy mayo) was $28 and worth every penny! Each hand roll had a generous amount of great quality fish. Can't wait for the Culver city location to open in October. Will certainly be back for more!

reviews.raw_text:
We were looking for a place to eat at the Arts District (Los Angeles) and ventured into the first place we found open at 5pm on a Mondayâ€¦ little we knew we were entering HEAVEN!!! Try anything and everything, Maribel, the hand roll expert, would be your best guide. And Vahe will great you with the best sake and Japanese beer advice!!!!

reviews.raw_text:
Delicious handrolls with lots of options for â€œsetsâ€ and â€œa la carteâ€ selection. Each fish option has a customizable â€œspicy or regularâ€ and seaweed paper or soy paper.
I love love looooved their Yunomi roll which has perfect texture and lots of flavor.
They have an impressive selection of Japanese beer including a matcha ipa and plenty of sake options by the bottle or single serve.

Will definitely come back!
